intro: Hieracium hercegovinicum, commonly known as the Herzegovina hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
